de.targodan.usb.io

Class PathSanitizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.targodan.usb.io.PathSanitizer

  • public class PathSanitizer
extends java.lang.Object
    PathSanitizer is a helper to clean up paths and resolve environment variables that may contained in a path.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PathSanitizer() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected static void overrideEnvironment(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> environment)
      OverrideEnvironment overrides the default environment.
      static java.lang.String sanitize(java.lang.String path)
      Sanitize cleans up a given path, replacing any environment variables contained in the native formatting.
      protected static java.lang.String sanitizeReplaceString(java.lang.String text)
      SanitizeReplaceString escapes the given text to be interpreted literally by a regex.
      protected static java.lang.String sanitizeUnix(java.lang.String path)
      SanitizeWindows sanitizes the given path replacing linux environment variables like "$HOME" or "~".
      protected static java.lang.String sanitizeWindows(java.lang.String path)
      SanitizeWindows sanitizes the given path replacing windows environment variables like "%APPDATA%".

      • overrideEnvironment

        protected static void overrideEnvironment(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> environment)
        OverrideEnvironment overrides the default environment. This is only used for tests.
        Parameters:
        environment - The environment to be used for resolving variables.

      • sanitize

        public static java.lang.String sanitize(java.lang.String path)
        Sanitize cleans up a given path, replacing any environment variables contained in the native formatting.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to be cleaned up.
        Returns:
        The cleaned up path.

      • sanitizeReplaceString

        protected static java.lang.String sanitizeReplaceString(java.lang.String text)
        SanitizeReplaceString escapes the given text to be interpreted literally by a regex.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be escaped.
        Returns:
        a escaped version of the given text such that it will be interpreted literally in a regular expression.

      • sanitizeWindows

        protected static java.lang.String sanitizeWindows(java.lang.String path)
        SanitizeWindows sanitizes the given path replacing windows environment variables like "%APPDATA%".
        Parameters:
        path - The path to be sanitized.
        Returns:
        the sanitized path.

      • sanitizeUnix

        protected static java.lang.String sanitizeUnix(java.lang.String path)

        Returns:
